greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Multiplicative order of 2 modulo prime(n)^2 for n >= 2.
comment: p=prime(n) is in A001220 if and only if a(n) is equal to A014664(n). So far this is known to hold only for p=1093 and p=3511.
This happens for n=183 and 490, that is for p=prime(183)=1093 and p=prime(490)=3511, with values 364 and 1755 (see b-files). - _Michel Marcus_, Jun 29 2014
If 2^q-1 is p=prime(n), i.e., for n in A016027, then a(n)=pq and lpf(2^a(n)-1)=p. - _Thomas Ordowski_, Feb 04 2019
link: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..10000
formula: a(n) = prime(n)*A014664(n) for all odd primes that are not Wieferich. - _Thomas Ordowski_, Feb 04 2019
results.author: _Felix Fröhlich_, Jun 14 2014
